Content_wSideColumn.Name: Equipment Available
Content_wSideColumn.Title: Equipment Available
Content_wSideColumn.Abstract: Below are popular pieces of equipment. Most equipment is offered here at A/V services, but other equipment listed show where you can rent them from.

MoveLeft.label: Toggle column right or left (right is default)

fbookTop.label: Put facebook at top of page

fbookDisplayed.label: Number of facebook messages to display

Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Speakers

We have small, medium, and large speakers.
Small speakers are good for classroom and conference room gatherings.
Medium speakers are good for larger groups, and outdoor activities.
Large speakers can only be reserved with special permission from the Event Services Supervisor.

 Projectors

We have small, medium, medium HD, and large Epson projectors.
Small projectors are good for classroom and conference room use.
Medium and large projectors are good for larger groups and venues.

Screens

We have one 4' screen, 6' screens, and 7' screens.
Our 6' screens are good for classroom and conference room settings.
Our 7' screens are good for larger groups and venues. 

19" LCD TV

LCD TV's (19" screens) are perfect for booths. They have built-in DVD players.

Plasma Screen

We have four plasma TV's available for reservation, but they are in high-demand. They are portable and have DVD and VCR capabilities.

Portable DVD player

 Plays DVDs, CDs, but not Blu-Ray. Can be charged for battery operation, or plugged in for extended use. About a 6" screen.

Blu-Ray player

Used for high-definition playback and has wi-fi capabilities. We do have 3D blu-ray players, but no 3D TVs.

Crab (Multi-Media DI Box)

Connects audio outputs and inputs to speakers or campus sound systems.

Overhead Projector

Projects transparencies onto screens or other surfaces for visual aid. Works through reflective lenses.

Vizcam

Projects what is under the camera lens through the projector onto a screen or other surface for visual aid. Works through recording devices.

Wireless Presenter

Includes two parts: usb doggle, and the presenter itself. The usb doggle goes into any usb port and allows presenter to work with the computer.

Table Easel

To display light weight objects on a table.

Floor Easel

Used to display objects by standing on the floor.

CD Player

Three CD players available. Can be connected to the house sound in many venues on campus.

 

Mackie Mixer

Used to provide more inputs for larger events. Only reserved with special permission from Event Services.

Other resources available for your event are provided by these departments:

Whiteboard Whiteboards are available through Custodial services.
Tables Tables and chairs are available through custodial services depending on the venue and  local resources
Laptops laptops are only available for rent from the Help Desk, located on the third floor of the library.
Video Cameras Video cameras are provided by the Circulation Desk on the first floor of the library.
